18  
19  package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.procedure2.store;
20  
21  import java.io.IOException;
22  import java.util.Iterator;
23  
24  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.classification.InterfaceAudience;
25  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.classification.InterfaceStability;
26  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.procedure2.Procedure;
27  
28  /**
29   * The ProcedureStore is used by the executor to persist the state of each procedure execution.
30   * This allows to resume the execution of pending/in-progress procedures in case
31   * of machine failure or service shutdown.
32   */
33  @InterfaceAudience.Private
34  @InterfaceStability.Evolving
35  public interface ProcedureStore {
36    /**
37     * Store listener interface.
38     * The main process should register a listener and respond to the store events.
39     */
40    public interface ProcedureStoreListener {
41      /**
42       * triggered when the store is not able to write out data.
43       * the main process should abort.
44       */
45      void abortProcess();
46    }
47  
48    /**
49     * Add the listener to the notification list.
50     * @param listener The AssignmentListener to register
51     */
52    void registerListener(ProcedureStoreListener listener);
53  
54    /**
55     * Remove the listener from the notification list.
56     * @param listener The AssignmentListener to unregister
57     * @return true if the listner was in the list and it was removed, otherwise false.
58     */
59    boolean unregisterListener(ProcedureStoreListener listener);
60  
61    /**
62     * Start/Open the procedure store
63     * @param numThreads
64     */
65    void start(int numThreads) throws IOException;
66  
67    /**
68     * Stop/Close the procedure store
69     * @param abort true if the stop is an abort
70     */
71    void stop(boolean abort);
72  
73    /**
74     * @return true if the store is running, otherwise false.
75     */
76    boolean isRunning();
77  
78    /**
79     * @return the number of threads/slots passed to start()
80     */
81    int getNumThreads();
82  
83    /**
84     * Acquire the lease for the procedure store.
85     */
86    void recoverLease() throws IOException;
87  
88    /**
89     * Load the Procedures in the store.
90     * @return the set of procedures present in the store
91     */
92    Iterator<Procedure> load() throws IOException;
93  
94    /**
95     * When a procedure is submitted to the executor insert(proc, null) will be called.
96     * 'proc' has a 'RUNNABLE' state and the initial information required to start up.
97     *
98     * When a procedure is executed and it returns children insert(proc, subprocs) will be called.
99     * 'proc' has a 'WAITING' state and an update state.
100    * 'subprocs' are the children in 'RUNNABLE' state with the initial information.
101    *
102    * @param proc the procedure to serialize and write to the store.
103    * @param subprocs the newly created child of the proc.
104    */
105   void insert(Procedure proc, Procedure[] subprocs);
106 
107   /**
108    * The specified procedure was executed,
109    * and the new state should be written to the store.
110    * @param proc the procedure to serialize and write to the store.
111    */
112   void update(Procedure proc);
113 
114   /**
115    * The specified procId was removed from the executor,
116    * due to completion, abort or failure.
117    * The store implementor should remove all the information about the specified procId.
118    * @param procId the ID of the procedure to remove.
119    */
120   void delete(long procId);
121 }
This page was automatically generated by Maven
